thread.title: Pupils left shaken after school coach collides with car | Meridian
thread.title_full: Pupils left shaken after school coach collides with car | Meridian - ITV News

author: itv.com
title: Pupils left shaken after school coach collides with car | Meridian
text:
Play video A coach carrying seven schoolchildren has collided with a car in West Sussex.
The crash happened in Turners Hill Road, Tulleys Farm, near East Grinstead at 7.50am
One person suffered serious injuries in the collision.
In a statement West Sussex County Council said "There has been a collision at Turners Hill between a car and a coach - Crawley Luxury running Route 903 to Imberhorne School.
"The car went in to the front of the coach.
"There were 7 pupils on board. We understand the children were not hurt."
A police cordon is in place Credit: ITV Meridian Martin Brown, Headteacher at Imberhorne School, told ITV News Meridian that the collision was an unpleasant incident for the students on the coach and that they were left shaken.
He added: "To the best of our knowledge there are no injuries. The students who were on board and who have come to school are being monitored by staff."
The male driver of the car was released by crews from West Sussex Fire and Rescue.
They used hydraulic rescue equipment to release him before he was assessed by paramedics and taken to hospital by ambulance.
Last updated Mon 19 Oct 2015 Travel Sussex
